    "name": "Initial prime of the first prime chain of length n under the iteration x -> 3x+4.",
    "comment": [
        "This is a special case of prime chains generated by f(x) = cx + d.",
        "a(11) > 8695354111. - _Donovan Johnson_, Sep 27 2008"
    ],
    "link": [
        "D. H. Lehmer, <a href=\"http://dx.doi.org/10.1112/plms/s3-14A.1.183\">On certain chains of primes</a>, Proc. London Math. Soc. (3) 14a 1965 183-186."
    ],
    "example": [
        "a(3) = 3 since 3, f(3) = 13 and f(13) = 43 are primes when f(x) = 3*x + 4."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "c[p_] := Block[{k=1, q=3*p + 4}, While[PrimeQ[q], q=3*q+4; k++]; k]; a[n_] := Block[{p = 2}, While[c[p] < n, p = NextPrime[p]]; p]; Array[a, 7] (* _Giovanni Resta_, Mar 22 2017 *)"
